data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Solar Energy Policy 2022 - Solar Power Projects - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides 100% exemptions on wheeling charges, stamp duty, and electricity duty for 10 years, deemed approval for land conversion for solar power projects.
data.eligibility: All existing units who wants to invest in solar power projects in Uttar Pradesh are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
Subsidy will only be given to plants or projects that are purchased or constructed after the date this policy was announced.

Beneficiaries receiving the subsidy would not be getting subsidy for the same from any other State Government scheme.

Land used for solar projects must have approval for non-agricultural use.

Solar projects need to be connected to the nearest grid substation, subject to technical feasibility.

Developers must enter into Power Purchase Agreements (PPA) with UPPCL.

Solar power projects must obtain deemed consent from the Pollution Control Board for establishing and operating the project.

data.nodal_agency: Uttar Pradesh New & Renewable Energy Development Agency (UPNEDA)
data.context: This policy is introduced to achieve a target of 22000MW Solar Power Projects up to 2026-27.
data.objective: The Uttar Pradesh Solar Energy Policy -2022 policy mainly focuses to provide low cost and reliable power to the people of UP, and to reduce the dependence on fossil fuels and achieve renewable power.
data.description:
Scheme provides various incentives to to stand-alone solar power projects with capacity less than 5 MW :

PM KUSUM Yojna (C-1): 70% state subsidy for farmers from Scheduled Tribe, Vantangia, and Musahar categories; 60% subsidy for other farmers.

PM KUSUM Yojna (C-21): Financial support of Rs.50 lakh per MW for solar projects on segregated agriculture feeders (for supplying power to agricultural activities).

Wheeling & Transmission Charges: 100% exemption on sale of power to UPPCL.

Stamp Duty: 100% exemption on land purchase/lease.

Electricity Duty: 100% exemption for 10 years.

Land Conversion: Deemed approval to convert land from agricultural to non-agricultural.

Land Purchase: Deemed permission to buy land exceeding the prescribed limit.

Pollution Control: Deemed consent for establishment and operation from Pollution Control Board.

Government Land Lease: Available at Rs.0.15 lakhs per acre per year for 30 years.

Incentives to stand-alone solar power projects with capacity above 5 MW :Sale of Power: 100% open access for projects above 1 MW.

Power Purchase by UPPCL: As per Renewable Purchase Obligation (RPO).

Subsidy for Transmission Line Construction: Subsidy based on project size (Purvanchal and Bundelkhand region).

Wheeling & Transmission Charges: 100% exemption for sale to UPPCL, 50% for captive use and third-party sale.

Inter-State Wheeling Charges: 100% exemption on intra-state transmission system.

Stamp Duty: 100% exemption on land purchase/lease.

Electricity Duty: 100% exemption for 10 years.

Land Conversion: Deemed approval for converting agricultural land to non-agricultural.

Land Purchase: Deemed permission to purchase land beyond prescribed limit.

Pollution Control Consent: Deemed consent for establishment and operation.

Capital Subsidy for Battery Storage: Rs.250 lakhs per MW for projects with 4-hour battery storage (minimum 5 MW capacity).
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link : https://niveshmitra.up.nic.in/register.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Uttar Pradesh New & Renewable Energy Development Agency (UPNEDA)
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the incentives after the approval of project from the concerned authority.
data.additional_info: UPNEDA will issue registration certificate which will facilitate the developer/firms to coordinate with department.For approval of Solar Power Projects will carry out competitive bidding, execution of PPA, statutory clearances, and coordinate with MNRE.
